0$Condition: Anxiousness associated with Depression$7/25/2019 6:27:02 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$4$"A lot of Drs won't tell women but Sarafem is Prozac
column2: EXACT SAME DRUG
column3: just changed the name because if the reputation that ""Prozac was for crazy people"" it's actual use was for depression
column4: so I've just switched from prozac to Sarafem for the same reason
column5: so if people see the bottle they don't judge you. But just wanted to make sure all of you were aware of this."

column1: 1$Condition: Premenstrual Disorder with a State of Unhappiness$4/11/2017 9:37:04 AM$Reviewer: Zbyqr
column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I took this medication many
column3: many years ago. More than 20 years ago. I remember the complete calm experienced while of dealing with my menses each month
column4: the stupid drama of it and messes I made because of bad decisions during. That little pill was a big help. I am disappointed that many Dr's now do not know this med and that it may have been discontinued. If it works
column6: it should have been left to deliver what many needed...ThEirik sanity back.

column1: 2$Condition: Bipolar Depression$10/31/2013 8:44:53 PM$Reviewer: CindieAc
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$Only on for a brief time and notice a difference in agitated depression with PMDD. I was in bed for a week

column1: 3$Condition: Depression$4/28/2013 9:08:01 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$

4$Condition: Premenstrual Disorder with a State of Unhappiness$3/25/2013 10:02:40 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  (Patient) $3$3$5$"Been on the med for a week now. Had partial hysterectomy and have been going thru me menopause 8 yrs now. Ovary/hormone symptoms been tougher to deal with this past 2-3 months.
One positive so far
column2: appetite has decreased (usually increases at this time).

column1: Had been taking Viibryd for about 5-6 months now; told to stop taking it while taking this med; luckily no withdraws since stopping Viibryd (knock on wood) depression has not worsened.
Hoping that more positive things come of taking this PMDD med. Two more weeks before I'll really know.  "
5$Condition: Premenstrual Disorder with a State of Unhappiness$4/25/2012 3:58:15 PM$Reviewer: sjgirl85
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking this medication for 7 months now.  It has honestly changed my life.  I wish I would have started taking it a lot sooner.  I have suffered from
column5: anxious and easily frustrated at some points of the month which seemed to center around my menstrual period.  I would cry for no reason
column6: get upset or mad for no reason
column8: got frustrated VERY easily and was extremely anxious at times.  It interfered with all of my relationships - my family (especially my parents)
column10: my friends (especially my rooommate and best friend).  I was reluctant to start taking this medication
column11: as I was afraid to feel like a different person or TOO happy or disconnected with reality.  After reading reviews
column12: I decided to start it... it was worth a shot.  I'm going on my 8th month and I feel like myself with a happy outlook on life
column13: a more balanced mood and more control over my emotions.  My frustration level has gone WAY down
column14: which was one of my biggest problems.  My relationships have become better and easier... and everyone notices a huge difference in my mood and personality.  The ONLY negative I have found is that I have gained about 10 pounds since starting it and my doctor says that is is related to the medication.  Totally worth it though!

column1: 6$Condition: Anorexia Nervosa$3/26/2012 2:31:41 AM$Reviewer: parrk
column2: 35-44 Female  (Patient) $2$1$3$i still did not want to eat after taking this drug. I continued to loose weight.

column1: 7$Condition: Obsessive Compulsive Disorder$12/26/2011 7:32:47 AM$Reviewer: Mr G
column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years$4$4$4$

column1: 8$Condition: Premenstrual Disorder with a State of Unhappiness$7/22/2011 4:07:57 PM$Reviewer: Tay12
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$3$5$I tried Sarafem for the first time to help with PMS.  I only took 10 mg for 14 days.  Yes
column3: it does take the edge off
column4: however I had a very difficult time sleeping.  I would lie awake for two hours some nights which is never usually an issue for me.  Another issue was that I could not achieve orgasm.  I had an option to cut the 10mg in half but I decided against it.  I will try a more natural route or even consider getting back on birth control.

column1: 9$Condition: Premenstrual Disorder with a State of Unhappiness$6/15/2011 1:26:33 PM$Reviewer: MORELIKEME
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$4$4$I've been on Sarafem for 3 weeks now for PMDD. I have to say I'm thrilled with the results so far. I am more stable in mood
column3: my breasts weren't tender with my period
column4: I have less symptoms of PMDD (my hubby noticed a difference!) and I just feel more like myself. I take it at night b/c it tends to make me a little tired if I take it in the morning. I have also lost weight which has been an issue with my past history of anorexia. I am never hungry. The fog I felt the first week went away and I feel like doing normal things (playing with the kids
column6: grocery shopping) again. My aches and pains I used to feel are also gone. I almost worry this is to good to be true. I feel wonderful. I take 10 mg each day. Start with small dose and work up from that dose if you need to increase. High dose gave me anxiety. I hope this drug helps you as it has helped me
column7: you aren't alone in the way you feel! Keep trying!

column1: 10$Condition: Other$9/14/2010 7:28:49 PM$Reviewer: patty
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$has made me loose weight and too be more at ease with every day life

column1: 11$Condition: Premenstrual Disorder with a State of Unhappiness$6/10/2010 9:43:06 PM$Reviewer: FL MOM
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"I asked my Dr if there was anything I could take for that anxious and ""short-fuse"" feeling I had each month
column3: before my cycle.  She told me about Sarafem.  I told her I didn't want to really take anti-depressants.  She told me about taking it for 14 days
column4: before my cycle.  I've been taking it for over a year now and it has been a blessing.  I haven't experienced any negative side effects
column5: except a lack of sex drive.  That could be due to communication problems in my marriage
column6: but I noticed the lack of intrest in sex increased when I began Sarafem.  I read the reviews for Paxil CR and Zoloft
column7: hoping to find another treatment for PMDD without the lack of interest in sex drive
column8: but Sarafem has the most positive reviews.  I take 10mg of Fluoxetine HCL for 14 days each month and I'm very pleased with how I feel each month.  It has made me feel less anxious and generally content.  "

column1: 12$Condition: Premenstrual Disorder with a State of Unhappiness$5/17/2010 7:09:39 AM$Reviewer: missy
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$3$5$"I have been using this drug for four days now.  I am noticing that I have the ""I don't care"" attitude to situations where I would normally over-react to.  Be careful taking this with Robatussin (battling a cold).  It caused me to be a bit confused and disorientated

column1: 13$Condition: Premenstrual Disorder with a State of Unhappiness$2/23/2010 7:19:07 PM$Reviewer: LIMom
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I take 10mg for just 14 days before I get my period.  It definitely helps with my mood and uncontrollable anger.  Before taking this
column3: the silliest things would make me want to scream!  When my husband asked me why I take it
column4: I tell him that I take it in order to extend HIS life expectancy :-)  Enough Said?

column1: 14$Condition: Bipolar Depression$1/25/2010 9:46:44 AM$Reviewer: ItryTOnotGIVEup
column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$3$4$I'm 13 and I have been taking sarafem for a long period of time now. I have a very bad stage of depression and it hasnt worked the best for me. Some people don't take me seriously when I say that this drug hasn't worked. My doctor said that she would put me on a stronger dosage but never did. If you have extreme depression
column3: ask your doctor for a strong dose. Mild depression will not work with the first dose that they give to you.
